note.p: Education: Newcastle Preparatory School; Bootham School, York (1894-1898); Durham School of Science (1898); King's College Cambridge (1900). BA (1903 Cambridge, First Class Nat Sci Tripos)

Career: Student Assistant, National Physical Laboratory (NPL) (1903); Junior Demonstrator in Physics, University College, Aberystwyth (1905); Chemist, National Peat Industries Ltd (1906); Metrology Division, NPL (1908); Sunbeam Lamp Company, Gateshead (1909); Demonstrator and Lecture in Physics, Manchester College of Technology (1912); Superintendent, Eskdalemuir Observatory, Meteorological Office (1913-1916); Friends Ambulance Unit, attached to 16th French Infantry Division (1916); research, Aerological Observatory, Benson, Oxford (1919-1920); Lecturer in Physics, Training College, Westminster (1920); Member, International Commission for the study of Upper Air and Technical Sub-Committee on Atmospheric Pollution; Principal, Paisley College of Technology and School of Art (1929); retired (1940)
AssocMaterial: NCUACS 44/6/93. Papers deposited in Cambridge University Library
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1954 vol 9 pp 217-235, plate, by E Gold
References: Bertha Swirles Jeffreys, 'John Arthur Gaunt (1904-1944)' in NR 1990 vol 44 pp 73-79
